ygData.subject: RE: Less useful skills *Spoiler*
ygData.messageBody:
hmmmmm yes :)


>From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Less useful skills *Spoiler*
>Date: Mon, 20 Sep 1999 12:23:32 -0500
>
>From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
>
>Does this mean a bard's disarm traps caps at 100?
>
>- Faras
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Rokenn Swiftsong [mailto:rokenn@...]
> > Sent: Monday, September 20, 1999 12:30 PM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Less useful skills *Spoiler*
> >
> >
> > From: "Rokenn Swiftsong" <rokenn@...>
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > >From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
> > >Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > >To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > >Subject: Re: [eqbards] Less useful skills
> > >Date: Mon, 20 Sep 1999 13:10:12 -0400
> > >
> > >From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >kim@... wrote:
> > >
> > > > From: <kim@...>
> > > >
> > > > I trained disarm traps. Ignoring for the moment that there
> > > > are no traps in the game to disarm, does anyone know how we're
> > > > supposed to disarm traps when we don't get locate traps?
> > > > Relying on a rogue to locate the traps for you is pointless
> > > > since he'll be better at disarming them. And finding traps by
> > > > triggering them is also pointless since once they're triggered
> > > > they don't need to be disarmed (unless of course they're
> > > > designed to be continuous, which would seem to make locate
> > > > traps useless).
> > > >
> > >
> > >I too have trained in this, but never actually found
> > anything to disarm.
> > >
> >
> > In Sol A near the entrance there is a swinging blade trap.
> > Go there and
> > click on it or use the 'u' key. You will max to 100 in no
> > time. You can
> > even do it while using invisiblity song :)
> >
> >
> >
